programme.title: Live Tennis
programme.desc: The Internazionali BNL d'Italia. Coverage of day eight of the WTA 1000 and ATP 1000 tournament, a clay-court event held at Foro Italico in Rome. Alejandro Tabilo followed up his stunning victory over Novak Djokovic last year by successfully navigating his way past Karen Khachanov in round four, triumphing 7-6, 7-6 to book his passage into the quarter-finals. Elsewhere, number two seed Daniil Medvedev saw his quest for the title come to an end as he was eliminated 1-6, 4-6 by Tommy Paul.

programme.title: Live EFL
programme.desc: Stockport County v Leyton Orient (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the first League One play-off semi-final second-leg match Edgeley Park, with the team who finished third in the table hosting the side who finished sixth. These sides met at this ground back in September as the visitors scored twice in both halves to claim a 4-1 victory over their hosts. The win moved Orient out of the relegation zone after a slow start to the season that had seen them lose four of their opening five games.(n)

programme.title: Beach Rats
programme.desc: Powerful drama about a troubled Brooklyn teen aimlessly drifting through summer while struggling to come to terms with his own desires. Starring Harris Dickinson.(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind, hard-drinking war veteran pays a timid college student to accompany him on a weekend break in the big city, where he plans to make the most of life. However, the youngster is shocked to learn that at the end of their trip, his new friend plans to kill himself. Comedy drama, starring an Oscar-winning Al Pacino, Chris O'Donnell, Gabrielle Anwar and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Minyan
programme.desc: New York City during the 1980s, and a young gay Russian immigrant looks to escape the constraints of his community and find a world teeming with possibilities. Drama, starring Samuel H Levine and Ron Rifkin.(n)

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton.(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A rebellious, hip-swinging student from the city moves to a small religious community, where he instantly clashes with an old-school fire-and-brimstone preacher - who has banned dancing and rock 'n' roll because he considers them immoral. Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker.(n)

programme.title: 8 Mile
programme.desc: A white rapper strives to make a name for himself on the music scene, but his deprived home life on a Detroit trailer park and romantic complications put a damper on his plans as he struggles to win over the crowds and earn the respect of his peers. Drama, starring Eminem, Kim Basinger, Mekhi Phifer and Brittany Murphy.(n)

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: Minyan
programme.desc: New York City during the 1980s, and a young gay Russian immigrant looks to escape the constraints of his community and find a world teeming with possibilities. Drama, starring Samuel H Levine and Ron Rifkin.(n)

programme.title: Beach Rats
programme.desc: Powerful drama about a troubled Brooklyn teen aimlessly drifting through summer while struggling to come to terms with his own desires. Starring Harris Dickinson.(n)

programme.title: Sunset Boulevard
programme.desc: A faded film star from the silent-movie era is fixated with making a comeback. When she meets a struggling screenwriter on the run from debt collectors, she persuades him to write a script that will mark her spectacular return to the screen. However, he takes advantage of the deluded actress, becoming her lover in a relationship where their mutual deceit ends in tragedy. Drama, with Gloria Swanson, William Holden and Eric von Stroheim.(n)

programme.title: Cries and Whispers
programme.desc: Agnes, a woman dying of cancer, is visited in her remote home by her two sisters. Far from offering comfort, their arrival brings long-buried family conflicts bubbling to the surface, with tensions rising as Agnes' health deteriorates. Ingmar Bergman's drama, starring Harriet Andersson, Liv Ullmann and Ingrid Thulin. In Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Monsoon
programme.desc: A British-Vietnamese man returns to his birth country for the first time in more than 30 years. He was only eight when he and his family escaped Saigon as boat refugees during the Vietnam-American war. Now he embarks on a personal journey from Saigon to Hanoi to find a place to scatter his parents' ashes. Drama, starring Henry Golding, Parker Sawyers, David Tran and Molly Harris.(n)

programme.title: Molly's Game
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game for a decade before being arrested in the middle of the night by FBI agents wielding automatic weapons. Her players included Hollywood royalty, sports stars, business titans and finally - unbeknownst to her - the Russian Mob. Directed by The West Wing creator Aaron Sorkin, and starring Jessica Chastain, Idris Elba and Kevin Costner.(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: A US congressman gets embroiled in a secret mission to provide covert military support to rebels in Soviet-occupied Afghanistan. Before long, he finds unlikely allies in the shape of a womanising CIA agent, a Texan socialite and the president of Pakistan. Fact-based political drama set during the 1980s, starring Tom Hanks, Julia Roberts and Philip Seymour Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: The spirit of murdered executive Sam Wheat tries to find a way to help his girlfriend Molly Jensen bring killer Carl Bruner to justice, and enlists the aid of fraudulent medium Oda Mae Brown - who is amazed and baffled when her supposed psychic powers turn out to be all too real. Romantic fantasy, starring Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore, Tony Goldwyn and a Whoopi Goldberg, who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her role as Brown.(n)

programme.title: Rurangi
programme.desc: After leaving a decade earlier, a transgender activist returns to the remote community of Rurangi, hoping to reconnect with his father. Drama, starring Elz Carrad and Arlo Green.

programme.title: Birdy
programme.desc: A young soldier devastated by his nightmarish experiences in the Vietnam War is committed to an Army mental hospital. He comes to believe he is a bird, and dreams of taking his fantasy to the logical, ultimate conclusion - by learning to fly. Alan Parker's psychological drama, based on William Wharton's novel, with Matthew Modine, Nicolas Cage, John Harkins, Karen Young and Sandy Baron.

programme.desc: A struggling hairdresser discovers a new sense of purpose when she meets a widower working to provide for his daughters. Drama, starring Hilary Swank, Alan Ritchson and Nancy Travis.

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Biopic of hip-hop group NWA, examining their rise to fame in the 1980s. The five members of the group drew inspiration from their anger at the dangerous world they saw around them, producing hard-hitting songs about urban life that redefined a musical genre. Starring O'Shea Jackson Jr, Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell, Neil Brown Jr and Aldis Hodge.

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson in her final film.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Following a gig, fading music star Jackson Maine happens upon Ally, a nightclub singer-songwriter. Their instant chemistry leads to a tempestuous romance as he helps her on the road to stardom. However, Jackson's alcoholism has explosive repercussions as her career blossoms. Oscar-winning drama, starring Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper, who also directed, and Sam Elliott.

programme.desc: Ageing rebel Sully has spent a lifetime avoiding responsibility. When Sully is reunited with his estranged son, he learns he is a grandfather, forcing him to reassess his attitudes and driving him to get to know his family before it is too late. Comedy drama, starring Paul Newman, Dylan Walsh, Bruce Willis and Melanie Griffith.

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: Celebrated British dressmaker Reynolds Woodcock falls in love with Alma, a shy but strong-willed waitress who refuses to conform to his meticulous way of living. Paul Thomas Anderson's Oscar-winning drama, starring Daniel Day-Lewis in his final role before retirement, alongside Vicky Krieps and Lesley Manville.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor, who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, Paul Reiser and an Oscar-winning JK Simmons.

programme.title: Aisha
programme.desc: While caught up in limbo for years in Ireland's immigration system, Nigerian refugee Aisha Osagie develops a close relationship with former prisoner Conor Healy. However, their friendship soon comes under threat as Aisha's future in Ireland is jeopardised. Drama, starring Letitia Wright, Josh O'Connor and Ruth McCabe.

programme.title: Catch Me If You Can
programme.desc: The story of Frank Abagnale Jr, who found notoriety as a teenager conning and charming his way across America. Posing as a pilot, a doctor and a lawyer, Frank was able to fund an extravagant lifestyle while outwitting the FBI at every turn. Fact-based drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hanks, Christopher Walken, Martin Sheen and James Brolin.

programme.title: Manodrome
programme.desc: Concerned about his girlfriend's pregnancy, Ralphie's life spirals when he meets a mysterious family. Writer/director John Trengove's thriller, starring Jesse Eisenberg, Adrien Brody and Odessa Young.

programme.title: The Illusionist
programme.desc: In early 20th-century Vienna, a man becomes obsessed with the art of conjuring after an encounter with a travelling magician. He decides to leave his homeland to explore the world and perfect his skills. He returns years later a very talented illusionist, and is bent on using his gift to save the love of his life from a marriage to a cruel and vicious prince. Mystery thriller, starring Edward Norton, Paul Giamatti, Jessica Biel and Rufus Sewell.

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet.(n)

programme.title: Rob Peace
programme.desc: A young man is torn between his father's shadowed past and his own promising future. Raised by his devoted mother, Rob Peace risks everything he has worked for to free his imprisoned dad. Drama, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, who also adapted Jeff Hobbs' book and directed, with Jay Will, Camila Cabello and Mary J Blige.(n)

programme.desc: As part of a patrol tasked with clearing stray dogs before the 2008 Olympics, former stunt motorcyclist Lang bonds with a hound. Drama, starring Eddie Peng and Tong Liya. In Chinese with English subtitles.(n)

programme.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
programme.desc: A shy, naive lawyer falls foul of a gunslinger while on his way to the backwoods town of Shinbone. His life is saved by a local woman, and he in turn devotes himself to helping the townsfolk while searching for a way to bring the bandit to justice. However, he finally comes to realise that a more aggressive approach will be needed. John Ford's Western, starring James Stewart, Lee Marvin, John Wayne, Woody Strode and Vera Miles.(n)

programme.desc: A talented surgeon's life unravels after an inexperienced colleague makes a fatal mistake. Medical drama, starring Elizabeth Banks, Simon McBurney and Joel Tolbeck.(n)

programme.desc: A couple rent a countryside house for a weekend with their parents, but their break is ruined when they discover it's inhabited by a 400-year-old poltergeist. Horror comedy, starring Nik Dodani, Brandon Flynn and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: Mob Cops
programme.desc: When a retired NYPD detective publishes a book about his family's mob connections, war breaks out between the police working for the city's big crime boss and the officers trying to bring them to justice. Crime drama, starring David Arquette and Kevin Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills.(n)

programme.title: Speak No Evil
programme.desc: On holiday in Europe, American couple Ben and Louise Dalton and their anxiety-crippled daughter Agnes meet English doctor Patrick Feld, his wife Ciara and their young son Ant, who was born without a tongue. programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview - May 2025 1
programme.desc: Previews of the great films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture
programme.desc: Admiral James T Kirk and the USS Enterprise are called on to intercept an alien craft heading for Earth. Sci-fi action with the late Leonard Nimoy. Flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath Of Khan
programme.desc: Captain Kirk leads his crew in a desperate battle against ruthless arch-nemesis Khan. Sci-fi adventure with the late Leonard Nimoy. Flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek III: The Search For Spock
programme.desc: The crew of the Starship Enterprise steal their old ship and set out to free the trapped soul of Spock. Sci-fi sequel with WIlliam Shatner. Flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
programme.desc: Eco-friendly sci-fi with Kirk (William Shatner) and the crew of the Enterprise travelling back to 1980s San Francisco to save a pair of whales, and thus, the planet.

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
programme.desc: Captain Kirk and his crew are kidnapped by a renegade Vulcan in this sci-fi sequel, directed by William Shatner. With the late Leonard Nimoy. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew's imminent peace with the Klingons, is threatened after Kirk and McCoy are framed for the Klingon leader's murder. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek Generations
programme.desc: Time-travelling space epic uniting Patrick Stewart's Capt Picard with William Shatner's James T Kirk. Whoopi Goldberg and Malcolm McDowell co-star. Flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek: First Contact
programme.desc: Patrick Stewart returns to captain the Enterprise as his crew travel back in time to battle the Borg. Top sci-fi adventure. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek: Insurrection
programme.desc: The crew of the Enterprise oppose the Federation's plans to depopulate a planet which seems to grant its inhabitants eternal life. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Star Trek: Nemesis
programme.desc: Galactic peace is at stake when an evil clone leads the Romulans against the Enterprise. Featuring Patrick Stewart and Tom Hardy. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Barbie
programme.desc: Satirical fantasy comedy starring Margot Robbie and Ryan Gosling. When blonde and bubbly Barbie experiences a series of sudden crises, she must leave Barbieland to track down her human owner and make things right. But the adoring Ken follows her to Los Angeles where he discovers something called the "patriarchy" and develops some radical ideas...

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: Fantasy action adventure starring Gal Gadot and Chris Pine. Young Diana has been raised a warrior on the secret island of Themyscira, shielded from the perils of the real world. When she rescues an American pilot whose plane crashes off the coast, Diana learns about the horrors of the First World War, and leaves the island with him to fight for peace and justice.

programme.title: Madame Web
programme.desc: Superhero action adventure starring Dakota Johnson. While on a dangerous job, New York paramedic Cassie Webb has a near-fatal accident and develops precognitive powers. When she foresees that three young women are in danger, she sets out to protect them from the super-powered villain who wants them dead.

programme.title: Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga
programme.desc: Futuristic action epic starring Anya Taylor-Joy and Chris Hemsworth. As a child, Furiosa is kidnapped from the "Green Place" by wasteland marauders ruled by the despotic Dementus, who murders her mother. Growing up to find herself caught in the crossfire between two rival warlords, Furiosa devises a plan to escape and to take revenge on Dementus.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview: May 2025
programme.desc: A look ahead to the films now playing on Sky Cinema, plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: The Fall Guy
programme.desc: Action comedy starring Ryan Gosling and Emily Blunt. After a shocking on-set accident, stuntman Colt Seavers is taking some time out from the movie game. But when the lead actor vanishes from a film being directed by his old flame Jody Moreno, Seavers is persuaded to help track down the missing star and finds himself drawn into a disturbing conspiracy.

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: Monster movie starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson. When two giant monsters begin tearing their way from Japan to America, humanity struggles to find a way to stop them. At the 11th hour, the mysterious giant creature known as Godzilla, last seen in the 1950s, emerges to take the pair on. But is he on our side?

programme.title: Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire
programme.desc: Monster action adventure starring Rebecca Hall, Brian Tyree Henry and Dan Stevens. Since the Titans' last confrontation, Kong has decamped underground and is exploring the vast, fantastical world of "Hollow Earth". Meanwhile, Godzilla is up on the Earth's surface, keeping other monsters in check. However, a subterranean distress call initiates events that will see the two old foes face off against

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. Reporting from the frontline, Miller captures indelible images of the conflict, including the horrors found in the Nazi concentration camps at Buchenwald and Dac

programme.title: Arthur's Whisky
programme.desc: When Joan's husband dies, she discovers he'd invented an anti-aging elixir that literally takes the years off. Sharing it with her friends Linda and Susan, the rejuvenated women waste little time in painting the town red, but they soon realise it's a very different world to the one they remember. programme.title: The No. 1 Ladies' Detective Agency
programme.desc: When a string of break-ins reaches the agency, Grace inspects the damage and recreates the crime; Precious receives an unnerving phone call; a suspicious jeweler comes under inestigation.

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: While Lex Luthor (Jon Peters) plots against him, the Man of Steel (Brandon Routh) tries to reconnect with Lois Lane (Kate Bosworth) and find his place in a world that learned to survive in his absence.

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: The CIA's most dangerous former operative is drawn out of hiding to uncover more explosive truths about his past.

programme.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
programme.desc: A 19th-century martial arts master (Chow Yun-Fat) gives a sword called Green Destiny to his beloved (Michelle Yeoh), then the two must recover it from female thieves.

programme.title: The Front Room
programme.desc: Everything goes to hell for newly pregnant Belinda after her mother-in-law moves in. As the diabolical guest tries to get her claws on the child, Belinda must draw the line somewhere.

programme.title: Megan Leavey
programme.desc: Young Marine Cpl. Megan Leavey starts to identify with Rex, a particularly aggressive combat dog that she trains. Together, they complete more than 100 missions until an improvised explosive device injures both, putting their fates in jeopardy.

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A human soldier is sent from 2029 to 1984 to stop a cyborg killing machine, which has been programmed to execute a young woman whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

programme.title: Gimme Shelter
programme.desc: Filmmakers Albert Maysles, David Maysles and Charlotte Zwerin show the Rolling Stones' 1969 California concert.

programme.title: In the Fade
programme.desc: Katja's life falls apart in the blink of an eye when two neo-Nazis kill her husband and 6-year-old son in a bomb attack. Her quest for justice soon pushes her to the edge as the two suspects stand trial for murder.

programme.title: The Lionheart
programme.desc: In 2011, two-time Indianapolis 500 champion Dan Wheldon died in a horrific crash at the Las Vegas Motor Speedway, shaking the world of motorsports to its core. Ten years later, Dan's two sons, Sebastian and Oliver, follow in their father's footsteps.

programme.title: The Whale
programme.desc: A reclusive English teacher, living alone in the wake of a tragedy, attempts to reconnect with his teenage daughter for one last chance at redemption.

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: Teens meet with horrible ends after a classmate's (Devon Sawa) precognitive vision leads to their ejection from a doomed airliner.

programme.title: Final Destination 2
programme.desc: Death returns to claim the lives of those who did not die in a horrible highway calamity as they were meant to do.

programme.title: Final Destination 3
programme.desc: A high-school senior (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) and her friends must deal with repercussions of cheating death when they survive a terrible roller-coaster accident.

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: A horrifying premonition saves a young man (Bobby Campo) and his friends from death during a racetrack accident, but terrible fates await them nonetheless.

programme.title: Final Destination 5
programme.desc: When a man's premonition saves them from a fatal bridge collapse, several unfortunate souls learn that Death will not be cheated.

programme.title: A Private War
programme.desc: Celebrated war correspondent Marie Colvin charges into danger, constantly testing the limits between bravery and bravado.

programme.desc: After surviving a motorcycle accident, a former boxer and longtime agnostic starts to wonder if he can use his second chance to help others, leading to the surprising realization that he's meant to be a Catholic priest.

programme.desc: Walter Keane (Christoph Waltz) achieves worldwide fame for pop-art portraits of saucer-eyed waifs, but no one knows that it's his wife, Margaret (Amy Adams), who's the real genius behind the paintbrush.

programme.desc: Three high-school friends make a discovery that gives them incredible superpowers, but their lives spin out of control when their darker sides begin to emerge.

programme.desc: Aquaman must retrieve the legendary Trident of Atlan to save the underwater city of Atlantis -- and the surface world -- from his power-hungry brother.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: Black Manta wields the power of the mythic Black Trident to unleash an ancient and malevolent force. Hoping to end his reign of terror, Aquaman forges an unlikely alliance with his brother to protect their kingdom and save the world from destruction.

programme.title: Annabelle: Creation
programme.desc: Years after the tragic death of their daughter, a former toy maker and his wife welcome a nun and six orphaned girls into their farmhouse. Terror soon strikes when one child finds a seemingly innocent doll that appears to have a life of its own.

programme.title: Annabelle Comes Home
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren keep a possessed doll locked up in an artifacts room in their house. When the doll awakens the room's evil spirits, it soon becomes a night of terror for the couple's young daughter and her friends.
